events.comment: Idea for later: If hovering over will give a string that is used throught stuff like Global vars and names, then maybe we can reduce the code?
For each object, at the beginning of frame, set each "Background" object to a different frame and speed
Once the animation is over, change the speed scale again
When hovering over icon, set the UP X + Y position
When The Animatronic's AI is under 10, add a space (to avoid weird glitch)
When The Animatronic's AI is over 10, don't add a space (to avoid weird glitch)
When AI is 0, make the icon transparent
When AI is not 0, make the icon non-transparent
The the cursor is on UP & The left button is pressed & it's over the animatronic, and it isn't over 20, start the 'hold timer' and change the AI by 1
When cursor is released, pause the Timer
When the UP button is being hold and the 'HOLD' timer is over one, constantly add 1, and pause the timer when button released
/\/\/\ Same thing as above execpt with the DOWN key /\/\/\

objects.name: FURYBROKEN
objects.string:
This Floor is currently broken

Please fix once you get the the "Fury Rage" Section of animatronics

animations.name: Click on task to start it

events.comment:
TODO:
Fix Desk movement

events.name: At the beginning of the scene & 'Always'

events.comment: By default, hide the moving camera triggers
Make all Desk-like layers have a 'parallax' effect
If the mouse is over the Look_Left object, then move the camera left
If the mouse is over the Look_Right object, then move the camera right
In order to prevent the camera from moving outside the boundary, we will use the "Enforce camera boundaries" function
If the W key is pressed and the vent is closed, play the opening animation and set open to true
If the vent animation is opening and the animation just got done, keep it open
If the vent is open and the w key is pressed change the animation and set it to false
If the vent animation is Closing and the animation just got done, keep it Closed
Add Usage + Transparent
If the A key is pressed and the Door is closed, play the opening animation and set open to true
If the Door animation is opening and the animation just got done, keep it open
If the Door is open and the A key is pressed change the animation and set it to false
If the Door animation is Closing and the animation just got done, keep it Closed
Add Usage
If the D key is pressed and the Door is closed, play the opening animation and set open to true
If the Door animation is opening and the animation just got done, keep it open
If the Door is open and the D key is pressed change the animation and set it to false
If the Door animation is Closing and the animation just got done, keep it Closed
Add Usage
If the F key is pressed and the vent is closed, play the opening animation and set open to true
If the vent animation is opening and the animation just got done, keep it open
If the vent is open and the F key is pressed change the animation and set it to false
If the vent animation is Closing and the animation just got done, keep it Closed
Add Usage
If the space key is released, and the fan is on, on you can control it, then turn the fan off
If the space key is released, and the fan is off, on you can control it, then turn the fan on
If the fan is on, play the animation
If the fan is on, play the sound on channel 1
If the fan is off, pause the fan animation
If the fan is off, pause the sound on channel 1

Notes for Power in Ultra Custom Night

0 meter = 7 seconds

1 meter = 3 seconds

2 meter = 2 seconds

3 meter = 1 seconds

4 meter = 0.5 seconds

5 meter = 0.2?
Always, if the number is in the triple digits, then set the string to the power
Always, if the number is low than 100 but higher than 9, then add a space before displaying power
Always, if the number is lower than 9, then add 2 spaces before displaying power
Remove power at different speeds depending on the usage bar and power generator is off
Always set the Usage Value to the Usage percent (This is to prevent a glitch that can allow users to remove usage despite additional usage being used
Never let the Usage Value go under 0
POWER OUTAGE
Always set the Noise Value to the Noise percent (This is to prevent a glitch that can allow users to remove noise despite additional noise being used
Never let the Usage Value go under 0

This Event group will handle the "Detection" for it the object is in use. This will mostly be used for animatronics. The reason why I couldn't use the previous values are due to how they are program (for example, a value only gets set when the door is already closed, not while it's closing)
Theory for later: If I make it so if you press for it to close, but release it to open, could that work? Maybe..Maybe not
Change The hour based on time
Change the hour text
If the hour text says '6AM' then you win!
For Every 0.1 seconds, add 1 to the milisecond
Once the milisecond goes over 9, add 1 to second
For the Second timer, if it's in the single digit, display "01" instead of "1"
For the Second timer, if it's in the double digit, display "10" instead of "010"
Once the second timer goes over 59, add 1 to minute
Always display Milisecond Timer & Minute Timer to Label
In case VIsion Vent is not at 255 before oxygen fills up, set it to 255
== This Event Group handles the ON/OFF system of the cameras, includes the 'Camera_On'  Value
Show/Hide Layer
Set Mode ID if user clicks on the button/shortcut
Highlight button when activated
Change power values
Change power values
== This Event Group handles buttons (NOT including change camera buttons), Panning, Static, etc ==
When the fan is on, play the fan icon animation
When the fan icon is clicked and the fan is on, switch it to false
When the fan icon is clicked and the fan is on, switch it to false
When the fan icon is clicked and the fan is off, switch it to true
If Opacity is over 50, subtract 5
If Opacity is under 50, constantly set to 50
If the camera is on, show the static
If the camera is off, hide the static
When clicked on the camera buttons, set the static's opacity to 255
== Remaps the camera buttons depending on floor ==
Remap Floor 1 buttons
Remap Floor 2 buttons
Remap Floor 3 buttons
Remap Floor 4 buttons
Hide buttons if the currently viewing floor is above Floor 4
Show layer when camera is on and Camera Floor ID
When the camera is off, hide all floor layers
When the camera is on, show cam buttons layer
== This Event Group will change the camera depending on what floor + Cam number you are on ==
== This Event Group will change the camera depending on what floor + Cam number you are on ==
When on floor 2, show the CTRL for flashlight reminder
When the flashlight is off, show darkness
If the user is pressing CTRL, turn on the light
Bugfix: If the user is holding down the Control Key on floor 2, and switch floors, then auto turn off
Bugfix: If the user is holding down the Control Key on floor 2, and lower the cameras, then auto turn off
When the user let go of LControl, Turn off the flashlight
Add 1 to usage bar if the flashlight is on
on floor 2, if LControl is being pressed, show camera
== This Event Group add and ID and change the Cam3_Audio_Show to the button highlighted ==
On the floor, show the button
when not the floor, hide the button and audio show
When you click on the Audio button, it will activate, the Audio show will no longer follow the cam buttons, it will show itself, and will adjust position to be center
While active, wait 5 seconds before turning off
When it is off, hide the Audio Show and allow it to follow again
== This Event Group make the camera cam buttons interactive  ==
Field

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: @4ian
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: Bounce
eventsFunctionsExtensions.shortDescription: Bounce the object off another object it just touched.
description: Provides an action to make the object bounce from another object it just touched.
>  This *won't work* with Physics engine or Platformer characters. This is working with objects that are moved using actions or behaviors using **the forces**.
The Breakout-like example uses this extension to make balls bounce ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://breakout)).

eventsBasedBehaviors.description: Provides an action to make the object bounce from another object it just touched. Add a permanent force to the object and, when in collision with another one, use the action to make it bounce realistically.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: Bounce

eventsFunctions.description:
Bounce the object off another object it is currently colliding with, according to the angle and the speed of forces applied on the object.
Make sure to test for a collision between the two objects before launching this action. All the forces will be removed from the object, and a new permanent force will be added to make the object bounce.
eventsFunctions.name: BounceOff

events.comment:
To bounce the object realistically, we first separate it from the obstacle. The collision engine will do it by moving the object through the shortest "normal vector" of the edge that was collided.
We store the position of the object before being moved so that we know the angle of this "normal vector". Once we know it, we add a force in the direction of the normal vector, and we add the difference between the normal vector and the previous angle of movement.

eventsFunctions.description:
Bounce the object off another object it is currently colliding with, according to the angle and the speed of forces applied on the object.
The bounce will always be calculated *to go toward the specified angle (the "normal angle")*. For example, if the object is arriving at this exact angle, it will bounce in the opposite direction.

Make sure to test for a collision between the two objects before launching this action. All the forces will be removed from the object, and a new permanent force will be added to make the object bounce.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Bounce off another object toward a specified angle
eventsFunctions.name: BounceOffSpecificAngle
eventsFunctions.sentence: Bounce _PARAM0_ off _PARAM2_ assuming a normal angle of _PARAM3_

events.comment:
Check if there is a collision between the object and an obstacle and if so, do the bounce by stopping the object and adding a force so that it goes in the "reflected" direction, using the "normal" angle provided. 
This provides a realistic bounce.

parameters.description: The "normal" angle, in degrees, to bounce against
parameters.longDescription: This can be understood at the direction that the bounce must go toward.
parameters.name: NormalAngle

eventsFunctions.description:
Bounce the object off another object it is currently colliding with, according to the angle and the speed of forces applied on the object.
The bounce will always be vertical, like if the object is *colliding a perfectly horizontal obstacle* (like the top/bottom of the screen in a pong game). For example, if the object is arriving with an angle of exactly 90 degrees, it will bounce in the opposite direction: -90 degrees.

Make sure to test for a collision between the two objects before launching this action. All the forces will be removed from the object, and a new permanent force will be added to make the object bounce.
eventsFunctions.name: BounceOffVertically

eventsFunctions.description:
Bounce the object off another object it is currently colliding with, according to the angle and the speed of forces applied on the object.
The bounce will always be horizontal, like if the object is *colliding a perfectly vertical obstacle* (like paddles in a pong game). For example, if the object is arriving with an angle of exactly 0 degrees, it will bounce in the opposite direction: 180 degrees.

Make sure to test for a collision between the two objects before launching this action. All the forces will be removed from the object, and a new permanent force will be added to make the object bounce.
eventsFunctions.name: BounceOffHorizontally

eventsFunctions.description: the number of times this object has bounced off another object.
eventsFunctions.name: BounceCount

propertyDescriptors.label: Bounce count
propertyDescriptors.description: Number of times this object has bounced off another object
propertyDescriptors.name: BounceCount

eventsFunctionsExtensions.author: Tristan Rhodes (https://victrisgames.itch.io/)
eventsFunctionsExtensions.name: ShakeObject
description: Shake an object (position, angle or scale).
- Object slowly rocking back and forth (like a ship)
- Simulate engine vibration, earthquake, or pulsing
The top-down RPG example uses this extension for damage animations ([open the project online](https://editor.gdevelop.io/?project=example://top-down-rpg)).

eventsBasedBehaviors.description:
Shake an object, using one or more ways to shake (position, angle).
This behavior can be used on any type of object.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: ShakeObject_PositionAngle

eventsFunctions.description: Shake an object, using one or more ways to shake (position, angle). Make sure to "Stop shaking" before starting a new shake if it uses different parameters.
eventsFunctions.name: ShakeObject_PositionAngle
eventsFunctions.sentence: Shake object _PARAM0_ for _PARAM2_ seconds. Modify position amplitude _PARAM3_ on X axis and _PARAM4_ on Y axis, angle rotation amplitude _PARAM5_.  Wait _PARAM6_ seconds between shakes. Keep shaking until stopped: _PARAM7_

events.comment: Start/Reset duration timer
Pass input parameters to global variables so that onScenePostEvents can use them
Determine if the shake should keep going until stopped
Add default values if none were provided
If duration is less than a single shake, increase duration to make 1 full shake
Detect initial shake
Initiate the onScenePostEvents function

parameters.description: Amplitude of postion shake in X direction (in pixels)  (For example: 5)
parameters.name: PowerX

parameters.description: Amplitude of position shake in Y direction (in pixels)  (For example: 5)
parameters.longDescription: Use a negative number to make the single-shake move in the opposite direction.
parameters.name: PowerY

parameters.description: Amplitude of angle rotation shake (in degrees)  (For example: 5)
parameters.name: PowerAngle

parameters.description: Amount of time between shakes (in seconds) (Default: 0.08)
parameters.longDescription: For a single-shake effect, set it to the same value as "Duration".
parameters.name: TimeBetweenShakes

events.comment: Keep object shaking forever (if desired)
Run once before every shake movement

events.name: Correct for drift and reset drift tracking variables

events.comment: Move to correct any drift from previous shake
Reset drift detection variables
Calculate Position Shake
PositionDisplacement = (DesiredDuration - RunningTimer) / DesiredDuration * Amplitude * [-1 or 1]
Make initial shake NOT random so users can set a direction for a one-shake effect
After initial shake pick a random direction
Calculate Rotation (angle) shake
Every "even" shake, rotate clockwise
AngleDisplacement = (DesiredDuration - RunningTimer) / DesiredDuration * Amplitude
Every "odd" shake, rotate counter-clockwise
AngleDisplacement = (DesiredDuration - RunningTimer) / DesiredDuration * Amplitude
Save that initial shake has been processed
Calculate the fraction of shake that occured during this frame
Increase change for the first half of the shake (move away from original values)
Change position
Save movement to calculate drift
Change angle
Save movement to calculate drift
Decrease change the second half of the shake (return to original position)
Change position
Save movement to calculate drift
Change angle
Save movement to calculate drift
Stop shaking when the duration has been reached (or if the stop shaking function was called)

events.name: Correct for drift and reset drift tracking variables

events.comment: Move to correct any drift from previous shake
Reset drift detection variables

eventsFunctions.description: Stop any shaking of object that was initiated by the Shake Object extension.
eventsFunctions.name: StopShaking

eventsFunctions.description: Check if an object is shaking.
eventsFunctions.fullName: Check if an object is shaking
eventsFunctions.name: IsShaking

eventsBasedBehaviors.description:
Shake an object, using one or more ways to shake (position, angle, scale)
This behavior can only be used on sprite objects.
eventsBasedBehaviors.name: ShakeObject_PositionAngleScale

eventsFunctions.description: Shake an object, using one or more ways to shake (position, angle, scale). Make sure to "Stop shaking" before starting a new shake if it uses different parameters.
eventsFunctions.name: ShakeObject_PositionAngleScale
eventsFunctions.sentence: Shake object _PARAM0_ for _PARAM2_ seconds. Modify position amplitude _PARAM3_ on X axis and _PARAM4_ on Y axis, angle rotation amplitude _PARAM5_, and scale amplitude _PARAM6_.  Wait _PARAM7_ seconds between shakes.  Keep shaking until stopped: _PARAM8_

events.comment: Start/Reset duration timer
Pass input parameters to global variables so that onScenePostEvents can use them
Determine if the shake should keep going until stopped
Add default values if none were provided
If duration is less than a single shake, increase duration to make 1 full shake
Detect initial shake
Initiate the onScenePostEvents function

parameters.description: Amplitude of postion shake in X direction (in pixels)  (For example: 5)
parameters.name: PowerX

parameters.description: Amplitude of position shake in Y direction (in pixels)  (For example: 5)
parameters.longDescription: Use a negative number to make the single-shake move in the opposite direction.
parameters.name: PowerY

parameters.description: Amplitude of angle rotation shake (in degrees)  (For example: 5)
parameters.name: PowerAngle

parameters.description: Amplitude of scale shake (in percent change)  (For example: 5)
parameters.name: PowerScale

parameters.description: Amount of time between shakes (in seconds) (Default: 0.08)
parameters.longDescription: For a single-shake effect, set it to the same value as "Duration".
parameters.name: TimeBetweenShakes

events.comment: Keep object shaking forever (if desired)
Run once before every shake movement

events.name: Correct for drift and reset drift tracking variables

events.comment: Move to correct any drift from previous shake
Reset drift detection variables
Calculate Position Shake
PositionDisplacement = (DesiredDuration - RunningTimer) / DesiredDuration * Amplitude * [-1 or 1]
Make initial shake NOT random so users can set a direction for a one-shake effect
After initial shake pick a random direction
Calculate Rotation (angle) shake
Every "even" shake, rotate clockwise
AngleDisplacement = (DesiredDuration - RunningTimer) / DesiredDuration * Amplitude
Every "odd" shake, rotate counter-clockwise
AngleDisplacement = (DesiredDuration - RunningTimer) / DesiredDuration * Amplitude
Calculate Scale shake
Calculate object scale displacement, with linear decay over time
ScaleDisplacement = (DesiredDuration - RunningTimer) / DesiredDuration * Amplitude *  1/100
Every even shake, increase scale
Every "odd" shake, decrease scale
ScaleDisplacement = -1 * (DesiredDuration - RunningTimer) / DesiredDuration * Amplitude *  1/100
Save that initial shake has been processed
Calculate the fraction of shake that occured during this frame
Increase change for the first half of the shake (move away from original values)
Change position
Save movement to calculate drift
Change angle
Save movement to calculate drift
Change scale
Save movement to calculate drift
Decrease change the second half of the shake (return to original position)
Change position
Save movement to calculate drift
Change angle
Save movement to calculate drift
Change scale
Save movement to calculate drift
Stop shaking when the duration has been reached (or if the stop shaking function was called)

events.name: Correct for drift and reset drift tracking variables

events.comment: Move to correct any drift from previous shake
Reset drift detection variables

eventsBasedObjects.description: A bar that represents a resource in the game (health, mana, ammo, etc).
eventsBasedObjects.name: PanelSpriteContinuousBar

events.comment: This allows to detect a change of "intial value" on hot reload.
Create the child-object instances.
Create the label over the bar.
Pass the configuration to the behavior.

Children instances must be resized when the parent size change:
- background is resized to take the full dimensions of the parent
- the bar size is refreshed according to the value
- the label is put back at the center of the bar

The scale is set back to 1 because it means that the parent instance has the same dimensions as the union of its children instances.

eventsFunctions.description: Center the bar according to the button configuration. This is used in doStepPostEvents when the button is resized.
